Generation I.Red: When it swings its burning tail, it elevates the temperature to unbearably high levels.
Generation I.Green: (This entry was originally untranslated in English until it was reused in Pokémon FireRed .)
Generation I.Blue: When it swings its burning tail, it elevates the temperature to unbearably high levels.
Generation I.Yellow: Tough fights could excite this Pok é mon . When excited, it may blow out bluish-white flames.
Generation I.Stadium: It appears to be very vicious. It attacks with razor-sharp claws and won't stop until the enemy is defeated.

Generation II.Gold: It is very hot-headed by nature, so it constantly seeks opponents. It calms down only when it wins.
Generation II.Silver: It has a barbaric nature. In battle, it whips its fiery tail around and slashes away with sharp claws.
Generation II.Crystal: If it becomes agitated during battle, it spouts intense flames, incinerating its surroundings.
Generation II.Stadium 2: It is very hot-headed by nature, so it constantly seeks opponents. It calms down only when it wins. (Pokémon Red, Silver, or Crystal inserted) It has a barbaric nature. In battle, it whips its fiery tail around and slashes away with sharp claws. (Pokémon Blue, Gold, or Yellow inserted)

Generation III.Ruby: Charmeleon mercilessly destroys its foes using its sharp claws. If it encounters a strong foe, it turns aggressive. In this excited state, the flame at the tip of its tail flares with a bluish white color.
Generation III.Sapphire: Charmeleon mercilessly destroys its foes using its sharp claws. If it encounters a strong foe, it turns aggressive. In this excited state, the flame at the tip of its tail flares with a bluish white color.
Generation III.Emerald: Without pity, its sharp claws destroy foes. If it encounters a strong enemy, it becomes agitated, and the flame on its tail flares with a bluish white color.
Generation III.FireRed: It lashes about with its tail to knock down its foe. It then tears up the fallen opponent with sharp claws.
Generation III.LeafGreen: When it swings its burning tail, it elevates the air temperature to  unbearably high levels.

Generation IV.Diamond: In the rocky mountains where Charmeleon live, their fiery tails shine at night like stars.
